member.param: Child actions of this group will populate the created action bar.

Helps with creating a Data Context each time the actions on the bar have to be updated or executed. System-wide data providers (and data rules) are mixed in when Data Context is created. If you're creating an action bar for a local control, you can use :: as an implementation for this functor.

member.summary: Creates a context menu. This menu will be registered in the action bars list, so you must make sure it's disposed of. Calling makes sure it's disposed of after showing or instead of showing if failed to show.
member.param: Child actions of this group will populate the created action bar.

Helps with creating a Data Context each time the actions on the bar have to be updated or executed. System-wide data providers (and data rules) are mixed in when Data Context is created. If you're creating an action bar for a local control, you can use :: as an implementation for this functor.

member.param: Child actions of this group will populate the created action bar.

Helps with creating a Data Context each time the actions on the bar have to be updated or executed. System-wide data providers (and data rules) are mixed in when Data Context is created. If you're creating an action bar for a local control, you can use :: as an implementation for this functor.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ActionManagement.IActionContextMenu.BeginShow(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Shows the menu async at the given screen point. Don't dispose of the menu right after calling this method because it might be still operated onscreen. The menu will dispose of itself after you call this method, either when it's executed/dismissed, or immediately if it could not be shown (eg no items to show).

member.name: T:JetBrains.ActionManagement.ActionHandlerAttribute
member.summary: A class marked with this attribute implements action and is registered at the startup automatically. The class must be an inheritor of . Specify one or more IDs of the actions this handler will handle, a separate instance of the class will be created for each ID and will get the ID it should serve as a ctor parameter. If you do not specify an ID, the class name will be used for an ID, without the “Action” or “ActionHandler” suffix.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim
member.summary: Applies a list of s to an Avalon .

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.OptionDevTenBeta2PlantIntoStatusDockPanel
member.summary: In DevTen Beta2, the status bar itself lives on another thread, which makes it planting our controls very complicated because of the threading issues. That's why we prefer planting to the dock panel that hosts the status bar.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.AvalonStatusBar
member.summary: When non-Null, means the status bar we should be attached to. Note: this is used along the code path when we have the status bar hosted on the UI thread (VS10 beta 1). In VS 10 Beta 2, another approach is used. This code remains for possible other shells.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.StatusDockPanel
member.summary: When non-Null, means the on the bottom of the window, to which our status indicators should be added in a dock-right fashion. Usually the status bar itself sits in the same dock panel. This approach is used when we cannot deal with the status bar itself to put the items into it properly. The case in VS 10 beta 2, where the status bar control itself sits on another thread and causes a marshalling pain for us if operated directly. It's expected to be a really, but we'd fallback for cases when we find ourselves in an unexpected layout and look for just any suitable panel.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusBarInHwnd(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Tries to find an Avalon status bar in the given window. The window must be fully inited by the moment.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusDockPanelInHwnd(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Tries to detect the status line of the window

member.summary: Helper for attaching to a status bar. Places a panel for our items in among its indicators. Must be executed on the status bar thread.
member.param: The status bar to plant into.
The Avalon element to put on the status bar as its item.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.AddItemsHostToStatusDockPanel(JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime,System.Windows.Controls.Panel,System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl)
member.summary: Helper for attaching to the status line of a window. Places a panel for our items in between the status bar and resize grip. Must be executed on the UI thread.
member.param: The dock panel of the window status line.
The Avalon element to put on the status bar as its item.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusBarInHwnd_UiThread(System.Windows.PresentationSource)
member.summary: Take 1: find all explicit status bars in the application window. Workable on VS10 up to Beta2 (non-inclusive).

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusBarInHwnd_WorkerThread(System.Windows.PresentationSource)
member.summary: Take 2: in VS 10 beta 2, the status bar is hosted in another thread. There seems to be no legal way for ripping out the nested object graph. Do some hacks.

member.summary: Performs the bottom-up layouting stage, when the control calculates its desired size using the given constraints. Should give generally the same results as , but could employ the device context for the sake of optimization.
member.param: The device context to measure against.

The maximum available space (that could affect the shape of the control, or strip down unnecessary calculations over the invisible items). May be a with width and height equal to , which means that the size is not limited.
member.returns: The desired size, must be no larger than .

member.name: M:JetBrains.CommonControls.IConstrainableControl.SetLayout(JetBrains.UI.LayoutResult)
member.summary: Tells the control the details about the new layout applied to it by the controlling entity in conjunction with some . Typically, the control need not apply the given size and location because that should be done by the controlling entity. The control may change its presentation in response to the layouting details, for example, whether it's attached to the top or the bottom of the anchoring rect.
member.param: The layouting details.

member.name: P:JetBrains.CommonControls.IConstrainableControl.AutoActivate

The control may change its presentation in response to the layouting details, for example, whether it's attached to the top or the bottom of the anchoring rect.
member.param: The layouting details.

member.summary: Arguments passed to the TaskDialog callback.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.NotificationKind
member.summary: What the TaskDialog callback is a notification of.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.ButtonId
member.summary: The button ID if the notification is about a button. This a DialogResult value or the ButtonID member of a TaskDialogButton set in the TaskDialog.Buttons member.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.Hyperlink
member.summary: The HREF string of the hyperlink the notification is about.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.TimerTickCount
member.summary: The number of milliseconds since the dialog was opened or the last time the callback for a timer notification reset the value by returning true.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.VerificationFlagChecked
member.summary: The state of the verification flag when the notification is about the verification flag.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.Expanded
member.summary: The state of the dialog expando when the notification is about the expando.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind
member.summary: Task Dialog callback notifications.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.Created
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog once the dialog has been created and before it is displayed. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.ButtonClicked
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user selects a button or command link in the task dialog. The button ID corresponding to the button selected will be available in the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. To prevent the Task Dialog from closing, the application must return true, otherwise the Task Dialog will be closed and the button ID returned to via the original application call.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.HyperlinkClicked
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user clicks on a hyperlink in the Task Dialog’s content. The string containing the HREF of the hyperlink will be available in the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. To prevent the TaskDialog from shell executing the hyperlink, the application must return TRUE, otherwise ShellExecute will be called.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.Timer
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog approximately every 200 milliseconds when TaskDialog.CallbackTimer has been set to true. The number of milliseconds since the dialog was created or the notification returned true is available on the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. To reset the tickcount, the application must return true, otherwise the tickcount will continue to increment.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.Destroyed
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when it is destroyed and its window handle no longer valid. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.RadioButtonClicked
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user selects a radio button in the task dialog. The button ID corresponding to the button selected will be available in the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.DialogConstructed
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog once the dialog has been constructed and before it is displayed. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.VerificationClicked
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user checks or unchecks the verification checkbox. The verificationFlagChecked value is available on the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.Help
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user presses F1 on the keyboard while the dialog has focus. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogNotificationKind.ExpandoButtonClicked
member.summary: Sent by the task dialog when the user clicks on the dialog's expando button. The expanded value is available on the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.WindowTitle
member.summary: The string to be used for the dialog box title. If this parameter is NULL, the filename of the executable program is used. Default: Shell.Instance.Descriptor.ProductFullName

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.MainInstruction
member.summary: The string to be used for the main instruction.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.Content
member.summary: The string to be used for the dialog’s primary content. If the EnableHyperlinks member is true, then this string may contain hyperlinks in the form: Hyperlink Text. WARNING: Enabling hyperlinks when using content from an unsafe source may cause security vulnerabilities.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.CommonButtons
member.summary: Specifies the push buttons displayed in the dialog box. This parameter may be a combination of flags. If no common buttons are specified and no custom buttons are specified using the Buttons member, the dialog box will contain the OK button by default.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.MainIcon
member.summary: Specifies a built in icon for the main icon in the dialog. If this is set to none and the CustomMainIcon is null then no main icon will be displayed.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.CustomMainIcon
member.summary: Specifies a custom in icon for the main icon in the dialog. If this is set to none and the CustomMainIcon member is null then no main icon will be displayed.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.FooterIcon
member.summary: Specifies a built in icon for the icon to be displayed in the footer area of the dialog box. If this is set to none and the CustomFooterIcon member is null then no footer icon will be displayed.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.CustomFooterIcon
member.summary: Specifies a custom icon for the icon to be displayed in the footer area of the dialog box. If this is set to none and the CustomFooterIcon member is null then no footer icon will be displayed.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.Buttons
member.summary: Specifies the custom push buttons to display in the dialog. Use CommonButtons member for common buttons; OK, Yes, No, Retry and Cancel, and Buttons when you want different text on the push buttons.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.RadioButtons
member.summary: Specifies the radio buttons to display in the dialog.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.EnableHyperlinks
member.summary: Enables hyperlink processing for the strings specified in the Content, ExpandedInformation and FooterText members. When enabled, these members may be strings that contain hyperlinks in the form: Hyperlink Text. WARNING: Enabling hyperlinks when using content from an unsafe source may cause security vulnerabilities. Note: Task Dialog will not actually execute any hyperlinks. Hyperlink execution must be handled in the callback function specified by Callback member.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.AllowDialogCancellation
member.summary: Indicates that the dialog should be able to be closed using Alt-F4, Escape and the title bar’s close button even if no cancel button is specified in either the CommonButtons or Buttons members.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.UseCommandLinks
member.summary: Indicates that the buttons specified in the Buttons member should be displayed as command links (using a standard task dialog glyph) instead of push buttons. When using command links, all characters up to the first new line character in the ButtonText member (of the TaskDialogButton structure) will be treated as the command link’s main text, and the remainder will be treated as the command link’s note. This flag is ignored if the Buttons member has no entires.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.UseCommandLinksNoIcon
member.summary: Indicates that the buttons specified in the Buttons member should be displayed as command links (without a glyph) instead of push buttons. When using command links, all characters up to the first new line character in the ButtonText member (of the TaskDialogButton structure) will be treated as the command link’s main text, and the remainder will be treated as the command link’s note. This flag is ignored if the Buttons member has no entires.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.ExpandFooterArea
member.summary: Indicates that the string specified by the ExpandedInformation member should be displayed at the bottom of the dialog’s footer area instead of immediately after the dialog’s content. This flag is ignored if the ExpandedInformation member is null.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.ExpandedByDefault
member.summary: Indicates that the string specified by the ExpandedInformation member should be displayed when the dialog is initially displayed. This flag is ignored if the ExpandedInformation member is null.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.VerificationFlagChecked
member.summary: Indicates that the verification checkbox in the dialog should be checked when the dialog is initially displayed. This flag is ignored if the VerificationText parameter is null.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.ShowProgressBar
member.summary: Indicates that a Progress Bar should be displayed.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.ShowMarqueeProgressBar
member.summary: Indicates that an Marquee Progress Bar should be displayed.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.CallbackTimer
member.summary: Indicates that the TaskDialog’s callback should be called approximately every 200 milliseconds.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.PositionRelativeToWindow
member.summary: Indicates that the TaskDialog should be positioned (centered) relative to the owner window passed when calling Show. If not set (or no owner window is passed), the TaskDialog is positioned (centered) relative to the monitor. Default: true

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.RightToLeftLayout
member.summary: Indicates that the TaskDialog should have right to left layout.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.NoDefaultRadioButton
member.summary: Indicates that the TaskDialog should have no default radio button.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.CanBeMinimized
member.summary: Indicates that the TaskDialog can be minimised. Works only if there if parent window is null. Will enable cancellation also.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.DefaultButton
member.summary: Indicates the default button for the dialog. This may be any of the values specified in ButtonId members of one of the TaskDialogButton structures in the Buttons array, or one a DialogResult value that corresponds to a buttons specified in the CommonButtons Member. If this member is zero or its value does not correspond to any button ID in the dialog, then the first button in the dialog will be the default.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.DefaultRadioButton
member.summary: Indicates the default radio button for the dialog. This may be any of the values specified in ButtonId members of one of the TaskDialogButton structures in the RadioButtons array. If this member is zero or its value does not correspond to any radio button ID in the dialog, then the first button in RadioButtons will be the default. The property NoDefaultRadioButton can be set to have no default.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.VerificationText
member.summary: The string to be used to label the verification checkbox. If this member is null, the verification checkbox is not displayed in the dialog box.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.ExpandedInformation
member.summary: The string to be used for displaying additional information. The additional information is displayed either immediately below the content or below the footer text depending on whether the ExpandFooterArea member is true. If the EnameHyperlinks member is true, then this string may contain hyperlinks in the form: Hyperlink Text. WARNING: Enabling hyperlinks when using content from an unsafe source may cause security vulnerabilities.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.ExpandedControlText
member.summary: The string to be used to label the button for collapsing the expanded information. This member is ignored when the ExpandedInformation member is null. If this member is null and the CollapsedControlText is specified, then the CollapsedControlText value will be used for this member as well.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.CollapsedControlText
member.summary: The string to be used to label the button for expanding the expanded information. This member is ignored when the ExpandedInformation member is null. If this member is null and the ExpandedControlText is specified, then the ExpandedControlText value will be used for this member as well.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.Footer
member.summary: The string to be used in the footer area of the dialog box. If the EnableHyperlinks member is true, then this string may contain hyperlinks in the form: Hyperlink Text. WARNING: Enabling hyperlinks when using content from an unsafe source may cause security vulnerabilities.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.TaskDialog.TaskDialogParams.Width
member.summary: Width of the Task Dialog's client area in DLU's. If 0, Task Dialog will calculate the ideal width.

member.summary: The callback that receives messages from the Task Dialog when various events occur.

member.summary: If the action is available, then the that's added to the end of the list if there're too many items to show is enabled and can be executed. Also, a toolbar button is present to execute this same action. Executes on the primary thread.

member.summary: Fires when the collection is considered dirty and should be recalculated by the implementing model. Listens for changes in all the affecting properties, groups them, and then fires this aggregate signal.

member.summary: When the items get dirty (), this function is called on the secondary thread. You can use the static methods of to check if the calculation results are not needed anymore and it should be canceled.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.PopupMenu.IMenuItemDescriptor.Mnemonic
member.summary: If the menu is working in the mode, specifies the mnemonic to assign to this menu item. The letter holding the mnemonic will be underlined automatically. To specify a mnemonic, either: (1) set the to contain a plaintext copy of the item , with the mnemonic char prepended by an ampersand “&”; normal ampersands should be doubled in the text, or, (2) set the to contain the single case-insensitive character of the mnemonic, whose position in the will be determined automatically; it's also legal to specify a mnemonic not present in the text. May be Null.

members.member:
Tries to execute a mnemonic. If there's exactly one item registered for this mnemonic, executes the item. If there're no items, does nothing. If there're multiple conflicting items, selects them in turn, but does not execute.
The character to be tested, either a v-key or a char representation. // TODO: switch to using the accelerator tables Whether an item was executed for this mnemonic. If we've refused to execute (returned False), tells whether it's due to the mnemonic not found (False) or duplicate mnemonic (True).

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.PopupMenu.Impl.JetPopupMenuDoc.ExecuteSelectedItem
member.summary: Performs the action over the selected item, which should have enabled state for the action to succeed. Returns whether the execution was performed. If there is no selection or the item is disabled, just returns False.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.PopupMenu.Impl.JetPopupMenuDoc.ExpandSelectedItem
member.summary: If the selected item has a sub-menu associated with it, opens that sub-menu and returns the success flag. Otherwise, returns False.

member.returns: The next index, may be -1 if is or there are no [suitable] items.

Whether iteration is allowed over all the items, or enabled ones only.

member.summary: Paints the item according to the current layout. must be called before painting to achieve a meaningful result. The painting is performed within the , at the location . member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.PopupMenu.Impl.JetPopupMenuView
member.summary: Masters the Jet Popup Menu main body presentation. Is a topmost popup window that looks like an MSO-11 v-menu, performs low-level custom layered-window painting to achieve the alpha-channel transparency (non-rectangular form, shadows). Visually reflects the state backended by . Implements the control that is displayed by the method. Do not create directly, use frontend instead.

summary.para: Creates the menu object and supplies it with environmental data.
There are two main usage scenarios:
• Add items to , sink events like or , and call or , or their overloads and variations.
• If the items are simple, call and then or , or their overloads and variations.

member.param: Required. The limiting lifetime of the menu. As you're passing in some components, your access to these components is limited by some lifetime (usually, the lifetime of the entity into which they were injected). To ensure safe access to these components, this lifetime must be passed to the menu.
Required. Fonts manager. In shell-less scenarios, could be created on the spot.

Optional. Some functionality might be impaired if omitted.

member.summary: Shows the menu non-modally, calls your callback to fill the menu, giving you the lifetime for all the layouters and popup window contexts to be used with menu. The lifetime you give is just a limiting lifetime and is not critical; the lifetime you're given in the callback should be used for menu-bound entities.
member.param: The limiting lifetime for the menu. Not critical to have, but you should generally have one (i.e. one of your component).
Skip menu display conditions.
The callback for you to fill the menu with items. Gives you the lifetime of the menu's async show. Bind any per-menu entities to this lifetime.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.PopupMenu.MenuItemDescriptor.Mnemonic
member.summary: If the menu is working in the mode, specifies the mnemonic to assign to this menu item. The letter holding the mnemonic will be underlined automatically. To specify a mnemonic, either: (1) set the to contain a plaintext copy of the item , with the mnemonic char prepended by an ampersand “&”; normal ampersands should be doubled in the text, or, (2) set the to contain the single case-insensitive character of the mnemonic, whose position in the will be determined automatically; it's also legal to specify a mnemonic not present in the text. May be Null.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.CommonControls.AutomationProvidersRegistry

summary.para: Manages the automation providers, as available for our custom controls.
Automation provider implementations require referencing the Avalon assemblies, which we cannot do yet.

When an Avalon-aware DLL is about to query for providers on our controls, it should load the providers DLL and cause them to sign up for this Registry. Subsequently, controls will start returning the providers in response to their .

member.remarks: The default implementation should call into System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider::ReturnRawElementProvider.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.CommonControls.AutomationProvidersRegistry.Items
member.summary: Lists the provider entries. The key is the class whose instance is requesting the automation peer. The takes in an instance of the key plus some more things and returns an instance of the automation provider, converted to an LResult (.NET Object -> COM Object -> IDispatch -> LResult), or Null if not available.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.CrossFramework.AvalonBitmapInterop.RenderGdipIntoAvalonImage(System.Windows.Size,JetBrains.UI.CrossFramework.AvalonBitmapInterop.AlphaChannel,System.Action{System.Drawing.Graphics})
member.summary: Creates a GDI+ Graphics to render into, and returns the rendering result in a form of an Avalon image.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.CrossFramework.AvalonBitmapInterop.RenderGdipIntoAvalonImage_GdiBitmap_DIBitmap(System.Windows.Size,JetBrains.UI.CrossFramework.AvalonBitmapInterop.AlphaChannel,System.Action{System.Drawing.Graphics})
member.summary: Creates a GDI+ Graphics to render into, and returns the rendering result in a form of an Avalon image.
member.remarks: Thought it could re-use the bits of , but seems like it's not the way it works.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.CrossFramework.AvalonBitmapInterop.RenderGdipIntoAvalonImage_GdipBitmap(System.Windows.Size,JetBrains.UI.CrossFramework.AvalonBitmapInterop.AlphaChannel,System.Action{System.Drawing.Graphics})
member.summary: Creates a GDI+ Graphics to render into, and returns the rendering result in a form of an Avalon image.
member.remarks: Creates a byte buffer, a GDI+ bitmap right on these bytes, and then an Avalon image off these bytes. Could be easily turned into a to reuse its bytes on subsequent renders of the same size, but in this method if a GDI DC is created off the GDIP DC, then any transparency functions would fail (cannot get the back color it seems), like ClearType or even rectangles with alpha. So we cannot use it as a main method, and thus no use optimizing into a .

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.CrossFramework.AvalonBitmapInterop.RenderGdipIntoAvalonImage_GdiBitmap_DIBSection(System.Windows.Size,JetBrains.UI.CrossFramework.AvalonBitmapInterop.AlphaChannel,System.Action{System.Drawing.Graphics})
member.summary: Creates a GDI+ Graphics to render into, and returns the rendering result in a form of an Avalon image.
member.remarks: Creates a GDI bitmap, HDC on it, Graphics on that, and uses the GDI bitmap bytes to create an Avalon image off those. Not quite compatible with because the bits are created by anew each time.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.DataContext.GetDataRulesEventArgs.GetDataRulesEvent
member.summary: Fires when the a Data Context is about to be created and looks for s on Avalon UI elements to query for data. This event will fire when you call interface members on , or the method and its siblings. When you sink the event, add your data rules to the list. Do not set to True so that the event could bubble up and collect all of the data providers in the UI tree. Add your data rules to the end, which will make sure the deepest controls take precedence with their most concrete data (unless data rule priority is specifically overridden).

member.summary: Add your data rules to the end of this collection. See documentation for details.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.AvalonEx.MakeGeometryBrush(System.Windows.Media.Geometry,System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush,System.Windows.Media.Pen)
member.summary: For a geometry, creates a brush that could be used to paint a rectangle with a geometry. The geometry spans the whole brush area. The coordinate space of the geometry is assumed to be (0,0)-(1000,1000). It would have been better to have (0,0)-(1,1), but some of the Avalon geometry clippers revert to rough edges on sizes less than one.
member.param: The Geometry.
Brush. Optional.
Pen (brush + thinkness). Optional.
member.returns: The brush that paints the geometry.

summary.para: Creates a lifetime each time the control gets loaded into the tree of loaded elements.
This emulates a deterministic lifetime for WPF elements.
This overload does not take an outer lifetime and is suitable for use in purely-view controls that do not know any external lifetime.
Note that it's not technically guaranteed that the lifetime is ever terminated.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Extensions.CreateOrReuseWindow
member.summary: Allows to show popup UI when the user clicks a button. Shows the old window if not closed yet, or creates a new one if not shown yet or already closed.
member.remarks: Usually, in Avalon, the window would be created initially, and show-hidden on user actions without actually destroying and recreating it. In our case there're usually complex bindings running in the window, so we would not like them to be running in the hidden mode.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Application.WindowUtil.SetOwnerReliable(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Sets an owner for the form in a reliable manner. The problem with reliability is that if the owner is not another (ie cannot be used), and form-to-be-owned is not , then the netfx implementation will drop the owner assigned with WinAPI calls and replace it with its own parking window (kinda to prevent it from showing up in the taskbar). This is done after the handle is created and after all of the notifications, so we should wait some more and then reapply the desired parent.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Application.WindowUtil.ShowFocusCatcher(System.Void*)
member.summary: Shows a window that catches focus and then returns it back immediately, so that the window could process the activation message consistently and place focus on the proper child window. Without that it could happen that focus sits directly on the main window and no child is active.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.ImageLoader
member.summary: Loads images from assemblies. Looks up the image by name in several assemblies in this order: (0) The calling assembly. (1) Manual override (specified explicitly in call and alike). (2) Product configuration assembly, as given by the . (3) Platform UI assembly (the own assembly of the ). A fallback to the next step occurs if either the assembly is not available (eg manual override is Null), or the image could not be found in the assembly.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Options.IOptionsPage
member.summary: Represents a page in the options dialog. Class implementing this interface should be marked with attribute and have public constructor taking one argument of type to be loaded. It is recommended to name the leaf classes against the {Title}Page pattern, where Title is the display name of the page in the Options dialog tree and title bar. This way, it will be readily locatable in the code.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Options.IOptionsPage.OnOk
member.summary: Invoked when OK button in the options dialog is pressed. If the page returns false, the the options dialog won't be closed, and focus will be put into this page.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Options.IOptionsPage.ValidatePage
member.summary: Check if the settings on the page are consistent, and page could be closed.
member.returns: true if page data is consistent.

summary.para: Control to be shown as page.
May be Null if the page does not have any UI.

Will NOT be disposed of automatically. Import a lifetime in page ctor and attach the control to that lifetime. If you're returning self (-based class) as the control, then it's implementing already and its will be called automatically.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Options.OptionsManager
member.summary: Manages the Options Dialog subsystem. Must not have its own nontrivial logic, is just a façade for the subsystem's components. Within the subsystem, use individual components; outside the subsystem, import this component to avoid going into the implementation details.
member.remarks: An option page has three levels of existence: • ID, a unique string identifier. • Descriptor, an instance of the class. Created when adding pages to the manager. Lives until removed. • View, a WinForms control created from the Decriptor, lives only for the run of the Options dialog.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Options.OptionsManager.CreateOptionPagesTree
member.summary: When option pages tree needs to be presented, builds the tree structure. A new one is built each time so that to account for possible option pages dynamic additions/removals by plugins and user code. Page parent references are validated for existence and cycles when building the tree.

member.summary: Compares the current object with another object of the same type.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has the following meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This object is less than the other parameter.Zero This object is equal to other. Greater than zero This object is greater than other.

member.summary: Describes a tooltip on screen and provides the means for positioning it onscreen and controlling its lifetime. Don't dispose of tooltip infos until you're done with using their members, eg painters and layouters.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Tooltips.ITooltipInfo.HitTestToolArea(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Checks whether the given point falls within the tool area of this tooltip. The tooltip is displayed while mouse pointer is within the tool area. One window may have more than one tooltip for different tool areas.
member.param: Point, in the client coordinates, to be tested for falling within the area.
member.returns: True if point is within the area, False otherwise.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.Tooltips.ITooltipInfo.Layouter
member.summary: Gets the layouter that positions the tooltip onscreen. Null means the default layouter will be used, one that positions the tooltip against the mouse pointer.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.Tooltips.ITooltipInfo.Painter
member.summary: Gets the painter for the tooltip. Must be implemented. Must not be Null.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.Tooltips.ITooltipInfo.PopupWindowContext
member.summary: Gets the popup window context that fires the actions upon which the tooltip is dismissed. Null means the default popup window context will be used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Tooltips.ITooltipManager
member.summary: An interface for the tooltip manager component.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Tooltips.ITooltipManager.Show(JetBrains.DataFlow.LifetimeDefinition,JetBrains.CommonControls.IWindowlessControl,JetBrains.UI.PopupWindowManager.IPopupWindowContext,JetBrains.UI.PopupWindowManager.HideFlags,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Displays a tooltip using the given content and position, until user discards it with the action specified, or the timeout expires.
member.param: The lifetime definition of the tooltip session. Limits the tooltip life, also is terminated by the tooltip when it is hidden. Bind any tooltip-related resources to this lifetime definition.
The tip content layouter and painter.
Parent context for the tooltip popup window, and its layouter.
The list of actions that discard the tooltip (app deactivation is implied).
Time interval to display the tooltip for. If positive, specifies the number of milliseconds to show the tooltip for. If 0, uses the default timeout from .
member.returns: The popup window that controls the tooltip, or Null if the tooltip has failed to show (eg tooltips are not allowed at the moment, see ).

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.Tooltips.ITooltipManager.ContentMargin
member.summary: Gets the margin that separates the content rendered within the tooltip from the tooltip window edge. Also, this is the offset from the tip control location to the tip text location, which is useful for precise positioning of the text.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.Tooltips.ITooltipManager.HoverDelay
member.summary: Gets the standard hover delay, a period of time between the mouse-over and tooltip display, in milliseconds.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Updates.UpdateInfo
member.summary: Data about individual updates available for the current product. A collection of such structs is the output of the check-for-updates subsystem. Note: fields serialized as elements for the ease of XSLT processing, as we can add a new element to the parent scope at any time.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Updates.UpdateInfo.RootElementName
member.summary: Root element of the document containing a collection of structures. The children of those element should be of the type, in the XML Serializer sense.

summary.para: Vendor name.
for JetBrains products.
MUST be present.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Updates.UpdateInfo.Description
member.summary:
A freehand description of this update.
Optional.

summary.para: The URI from which the installation package could be download. This MUST be the direct download link, not the download HTML page (see for that), as the updater might use it for fetching the installation package.
This URI need not be unique and could point to the same versionless verbatim for any most recent release builds.
Optional.
A BASE64 stream with a serialized to be displayed as an icon for this update.
Optional.

The identity of this update. A link to the online information page for this particular update. MUST be unique among ALL updates — not only those currently available, but also any past and future ones.
MUST be present.
Whether this will be a free update.
If True, then the customer will not have to pay for the product.
If False, then the upgrade MIGHT require a license.
Optional.
If the pricing information is available for the product, specifies the price tag in freehand form.
should be used for free upgrades instead.
Optional.
Full name of the product installed by this update, which includes the product name plus any marketing version. This should not include the company name.
for JetBrains products.
will be used if not specified.
Optional.
Short name of the product installed by this update. This should include neither company name nor version number.
for JetBrains products.
MUST be present.
The four-component technical version of the product installed by this update.
MUST be present.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Updates.UpdateInfo.ReservedA
member.summary: All custom attributes go in here.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Updates.UpdateInfo.ReservedE
member.summary: All custom elements go in here.

summary.para: Short title for the update.
MUST be present.
The kind of the update, see for recognized values.
The predefined values are replaced with display text when presented, and custom values are presented as is.
Optional.

summary.para: When the updates manager is about to check for updates for this updates category, it collects the information about the local environment. The downloaded filter will be applied to this data. This event allows to replace or alter this information before it's used.
Initially, it's of the type, as gotten from the . You could change it to a serializable object of an arbitrary type.
This event should be advised on each shell startup.

When the updates manager checks for updates, it downloads the XSLT filter from , plus some optional query string parameters that identify the local environment, if needed. This event allows to replace or alter this information before it's used.
Initially, it's gotten from the , called of the result. You could change or replace the key-value pairs dictionary.
This event should be advised on each shell startup.

summary.para: Gets the list of update categories. Each one downloads its own list of available updates, and supports a single product.

The default category, ., is guaranteed to exist. Other categories could be added by plugins, as needed. They're persisted by the manager in the product settings, so normally you do not have to create it each time. However, it could be deleted if the settings are lost, if the updates URI is dead for some time, or if it is not activated for some time.

On startup, you should activate your category with for it to check for new updates and report them, otherwise it will consider the owner to be inactive or unloaded, hibernate, and expire after some time.
To create a new category

is the pairing method that's guaranteed to be called by the component container to tear down your component.

summary.para: This method is called on the component to populate it with default or loaded settings, unless the component implements and returns True from its handler.
The element is taken from the settings file, if available.
If not, and there are settings files from the older versions, and the component does not implement , this method is called with the old settings.
Otherwise, this method is called with an empty element or a Null value.
For the first time, this method is called right before component's init.
The settings-reading protocol might be executed more than once thru the component lifetime.

summary.para: Represents the frame that sites active controls, for example, the text control. This frame knows whether it's visible on screen, and sometimes it can cause the environment to switch so that the frame became visible.
In Visual Studio, an example of such frames is an editor tab or a tool window, in which case this implementation is based on the VS Window Frame interface.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.WindowManagement.WindowFrame.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.WindowManagement.WindowFrame.Bag
member.summary: Allows to attach payload. For instance, the raw VS Window Frame lives here.

summary.para: Notifies the hosted control that the frame has been closed and the content is illegitimate from now on.
Not guaranteed to fire.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.WindowManagement.WindowFrame.Disposables
member.summary: Lifetime control.

summary.para: Gets whether the frame is currently visible onscreen, which tries to take into account not only the visibility flag of the window, but also whether the window layout allows content control to be visible onscreen.
This property is guarded, which means that all of the property changes will only occur in the guarded context.
Gets the root parent HWND for this window frame. This window should be used as owner for window popups over the frame content.

The root parent window is the window that has no parent (see ) and whose descendant “contains” this frame. For HWND-based UI, it's the top-level window containing the HWND of the frame. For Avalon UI, it's the top-level window containing the HWND presentation source of the UI element (or Null, if the element is not parented by a HWND presentation source).

Could be Null if the frame is not hosted on an HWND or the frame implementation cannot provide this value. Could change if the frame is reparented into another top-level window (eg floating a VS10 text view element).

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.WindowManagement.WindowFrame.SwitchToFrameRequested
member.summary: Tries to make True. Even if successful, might not apply immediately, as the changes to the occur in the reentrancy-guarded context only.

summary.para: Gets the UI element that represents the window frame, in either UI framework, if exposed by the window frame.
For HWND-based UI, query this object for the interface. For Avalon UI, try casting to 2D or 3D Avalon elements.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.WindowManagement.WindowFrame.CreateDummyFrame
member.summary: Creates a dummy window frame that always thinks it's visible.

member.summary: Assigns a HWND to the HWND-based window frame. The frame will not listen to changes in parent windows chain or visibility, hence “static”, but it does not leak any system-wide event handlers if not disposed of.

member.summary: Takes a sample HWND from within the frame (or the frame itself, but could be a content window in it), watches changes in its parenting, keeps the up to date. Such a frame MUST be disposed of.

member.summary: Creates a new child window frame in a window frame, which always switches in sync with the parent window frame. Could be useful if you need to place two windowframed entities (eg text controls) in the same window frame.
